hadith_001.text: The angel came to him and said: 'Read!'. He replied: 'I am not a reader.'

hadith_002.text: When the revelation came to the Prophet, he was terrified and sought comfort from Khadijah.

hadith_003.text: The Prophet said: 'Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.'

hadith_004.text: The commencement of divine inspiration to the Messenger of Allah was in the form of true dreams in his sleep. He never had a dream but it came true like bright daylight.

hadith_005.text: The Prophet said: 'While I was walking, I heard a voice from the sky. I raised my head and saw the angel who had come to me at Hira sitting on a chair between the sky and earth.'

hadith_006.text: When the verse 'And warn your nearest kinsmen' was revealed, the Prophet ascended the Safa and started calling, 'O Bani Fihr! O Bani Adi!' addressing various tribes of Quraish.

hadith_007.text: The Prophet would stand in prayer at night until his feet became swollen. When asked why, he said: 'Should I not be a grateful servant?'

hadith_008.text: By Allah, there is no Surah in the Book of Allah equal to it (Al-Fatiha). It is the Mother of the Book, and the seven oft-repeated verses.

hadith_009.text: When the verse 'And glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High' was revealed, the Prophet said, 'Put this in your ruku (bowing position).'

hadith_010.text: The Prophet said: 'When the son of Adam dies, his deeds come to an end except for three things: Sadaqah Jariyah (continuous charity), knowledge that is beneficial, or a virtuous descendant who prays for him.'

hadith_011.text: The Prophet used to say in his ruku and sujud: 'Glory be to You, O Allah, our Lord, and praise be to You. O Allah, forgive me.'

hadith_012.text: The Prophet said about the Day of Judgment: 'The sun will be brought near to such an extent that it will be about a mile (from the people).'

hadith_013.text: The Prophet said: 'There is no one who gives charity from good (halal) earnings - and Allah accepts only what is good - except that the Most Merciful takes it in His right hand.'

hadith_014.text: The Prophet said: 'The believer will be brought close to his Lord until He conceals him and makes him confess his sins.'

hadith_015.text: The Prophet said: 'Feed the hungry, visit the sick, and free the captives.'

hadith_016.text: The Prophet said: 'Take advantage of five before five: your youth before your old age, your health before your sickness, your wealth before your poverty, your free time before your busyness, and your life before your death.'
